1.text: Therefore if you have any encouragement in Christ, if any comfort from His love, if any fellowship with the Spirit, if any affection and compassion,

2.text: then make my joy complete by being like-minded, having the same love, being united in spirit and purpose.

3.text: Do nothing out of selfish ambition or empty pride, but in humility consider others more important than yourselves.

4.text: Each of you should look not only to your own interests, but also to the interests of others.

5.text: Let this mind be in you which was also in Christ Jesus:

6.text: Who, existing in the form of God, did not consider equality with God something to be grasped,

7.text: but emptied Himself, taking the form of a servant, being made in human likeness.

8.text: And being found in appearance as a man, He humbled Himself and became obedient to death—even death on a cross.

9.text: Therefore God exalted Him to the highest place and gave Him the name above all names,

10.text: that at the name of Jesus every knee should bow, in heaven and on earth and under the earth,

11.text: and every tongue confess that Jesus Christ is Lord, to the glory of God the Father.

12.text: Therefore, my beloved, just as you have always obeyed, not only in my presence, but now even more in my absence, continue to work out your salvation with fear and trembling.

13.text: For it is God who works in you to will and to act on behalf of His good purpose.

14.text: Do everything without complaining or arguing,

15.text: so that you may be blameless and pure, children of God without fault in a crooked and perverse generation, in which you shine as lights in the world

16.text: as you hold forth the word of life, in order that I may boast on the day of Christ that I did not run or labor in vain.

17.text: But even if I am being poured out like a drink offering on the sacrifice and service of your faith, I am glad and rejoice with all of you.

18.text: So you too should be glad and rejoice with me.

19.text: Now I hope in the Lord Jesus to send Timothy to you soon, that I also may be cheered when I learn how you are doing.

20.text: I have nobody else like him who will genuinely care for your needs.

21.text: For all the others look after their own interests, not those of Jesus Christ.

22.text: But you know Timothy’s proven worth, that as a child with his father he has served with me to advance the gospel.

23.text: So I hope to send him as soon as I see what happens with me.

24.text: And I trust in the Lord that I myself will come soon.

25.text: But I thought it necessary to send back to you Epaphroditus, my brother, fellow worker, and fellow soldier, who is also your messenger and minister to my needs.

26.text: For he has been longing for all of you and is distressed because you heard he was ill.

27.text: He was sick indeed, nearly unto death. But God had mercy on him, and not only on him but also on me, to spare me sorrow upon sorrow.

28.text: Therefore I am all the more eager to send him, so that when you see him again you may rejoice, and I may be less anxious.

29.text: Welcome him in the Lord with great joy, and honor men like him,

30.text: because he nearly died for the work of Christ, risking his life to make up for your deficit of service to me.
